values.description:
When environment variable FFTW\_STATIC is set, 

‌

```shell
FFTW_STATIC=1 python3 setup.py build_ext --inplace
```

will link FFTW statically into the fftw and transpose .so objects. This will allow the use of MKL and FFTW together in Dedalus.
values.title: added logic to statically link FFTW to use conda numpy with MKL.

summary.raw:
When environment variable FFTW\_STATIC is set, 

‌

```shell
FFTW_STATIC=1 python3 setup.py build_ext --inplace
```

will link FFTW statically into the fftw and transpose .so objects. This will allow the use of MKL and FFTW together in Dedalus.
summary.html:
When environment variable FFTW_STATIC is set,

‌

FFTW_STATIC=1 python3 setup.py build_ext --inplace

will link FFTW statically into the fftw and transpose .so objects. This will allow the use of MKL and FFTW together in Dedalus.

values.description:
This PR modifies setup.py and auxiliary files to make Dedalus pip-installable using more modern pip practices. In particular, [MANIFEST.in](http://MANIFEST.in) and pyproject.toml are used to make sure the necessary files are included in a sdist for pip, and that pip grabs the correct build-time requirements \(e.g. cython\) before trying to run setup.py.

It also adds the flags needed to statically link FFTW with clang on Mac.
values.title: Update for modern pip installation

summary.raw:
This PR modifies setup.py and auxiliary files to make Dedalus pip-installable using more modern pip practices. In particular, [MANIFEST.in](http://MANIFEST.in) and pyproject.toml are used to make sure the necessary files are included in a sdist for pip, and that pip grabs the correct build-time requirements \(e.g. cython\) before trying to run setup.py.

It also adds the flags needed to statically link FFTW with clang on Mac.
summary.html:
This PR modifies setup.py and auxiliary files to make Dedalus pip-installable using more modern pip practices. In particular, MANIFEST.in and pyproject.toml are used to make sure the necessary files are included in a sdist for pip, and that pip grabs the correct build-time requirements (e.g. cython) before trying to run setup.py.

It also adds the flags needed to statically link FFTW with clang on Mac.

values.title: Added documentation for using dedalus with AWS.

values.description:
This PR adds a simple interface for running tests and benchmarks via pytest and adds a range of tests that cover all problem types and bases.

‌

The additions to the main interface allow you to run the tests/benchmarks with the commands:

`python3 -m dedalus test`

`python3 -m dedalus bench`
values.title: Add pytest framework and end-to-end solver tests

summary.raw:
This PR adds a simple interface for running tests and benchmarks via pytest and adds a range of tests that cover all problem types and bases.

‌

The additions to the main interface allow you to run the tests/benchmarks with the commands:

`python3 -m dedalus test`

`python3 -m dedalus bench`
summary.html:
This PR adds a simple interface for running tests and benchmarks via pytest and adds a range of tests that cover all problem types and bases.

‌

The additions to the main interface allow you to run the tests/benchmarks with the commands:

python3 -m dedalus test

python3 -m dedalus bench

values.description:
This PR isolates the sparse matrix solver routines in wrapper classes in a separate libraries module. This makes it much simpler to implement, test, and compare different matrix solver routines. It also allows the solver routine to be specified as a keyword at solver instantiation.

‌

Several new routines are provided in the library, including block inverse solvers for fully Fourier problems. An optimized replacement for scipy’s sparse block\_diag routine is also implemented and backported to the Fourier pencil creation.
values.title: Isolate and wrap matrix solvers

summary.raw:
This PR isolates the sparse matrix solver routines in wrapper classes in a separate libraries module. This makes it much simpler to implement, test, and compare different matrix solver routines. It also allows the solver routine to be specified as a keyword at solver instantiation.

‌

Several new routines are provided in the library, including block inverse solvers for fully Fourier problems. An optimized replacement for scipy’s sparse block\_diag routine is also implemented and backported to the Fourier pencil creation.
summary.html:
This PR isolates the sparse matrix solver routines in wrapper classes in a separate libraries module. This makes it much simpler to implement, test, and compare different matrix solver routines. It also allows the solver routine to be specified as a keyword at solver instantiation.

‌

Several new routines are provided in the library, including block inverse solvers for fully Fourier problems. An optimized replacement for scipy’s sparse block_diag routine is also implemented and backported to the Fourier pencil creation.

values.description:
This PR adds Hermite and Laguerre polynomial bases with sparse differentiation. The Hermite node/weight construction from scipy uses Townsend’s asymptotic formulas so works for any size. The Laguerre node/weight construction fails above N ~ 256. Both bases use pre-weighted recursions in float128 to construct the basis functions.

Potential improvements:

* Better Laguerre node/weight construction for larger sizes
* Add multiplication matrices to enable NCCs? Can this be done sparsely?
* Potentially add explicit recursions for computing derivatives \(Laguerre is dense\).
values.title: Hermite and Laguerre bases

summary.raw:
This PR adds Hermite and Laguerre polynomial bases with sparse differentiation. The Hermite node/weight construction from scipy uses Townsend’s asymptotic formulas so works for any size. The Laguerre node/weight construction fails above N ~ 256. Both bases use pre-weighted recursions in float128 to construct the basis functions.

Potential improvements:

* Better Laguerre node/weight construction for larger sizes
* Add multiplication matrices to enable NCCs? Can this be done sparsely?
* Potentially add explicit recursions for computing derivatives \(Laguerre is dense\).
summary.html:
This PR adds Hermite and Laguerre polynomial bases with sparse differentiation. The Hermite node/weight construction from scipy uses Townsend’s asymptotic formulas so works for any size. The Laguerre node/weight construction fails above N ~ 256. Both bases use pre-weighted recursions in float128 to construct the basis functions.

Potential improvements:

  • Better Laguerre node/weight construction for larger sizes
  • Add multiplication matrices to enable NCCs? Can this be done sparsely?
  • Potentially add explicit recursions for computing derivatives (Laguerre is dense).

values.description: I have updated `sparse.py` for the new matsolve library. Tested using the `rayleigh_benard.py` 1D sparse eigenvalue problem.
values.title: Bug fix for issue #60

values.description: This PR substantially alters matrix construction to accommodate constant-in-z fields, allowing for the efficient integration of ODEs along with Chebyshev models. It also implements a range of fixes to the Laguerre/Compound bases, allowing for more general Compound structures involving both Chebyshev and Laguerre.
values.title: ODE integration

summary.raw: This PR substantially alters matrix construction to accommodate constant-in-z fields, allowing for the efficient integration of ODEs along with Chebyshev models. It also implements a range of fixes to the Laguerre/Compound bases, allowing for more general Compound structures involving both Chebyshev and Laguerre.
summary.html: This PR substantially alters matrix construction to accommodate constant-in-z fields, allowing for the efficient integration of ODEs along with Chebyshev models. It also implements a range of fixes to the Laguerre/Compound bases, allowing for more general Compound structures involving both Chebyshev and Laguerre.

values.title: Lowered CFL safety factor to 0.5; switched timestepper to SBDF2 for 3D run.

summary.html: This fixes issue #70.
